title: Change in children per woman and female labor force participation
subtitle: The labor force participation rate corresponds to the proportion of the population ages 15 and older that is economically active. Fertility corresponds to the number of children that would be born to a woman if she were to live to the end of her childbearing years and bear children in accordance with the age-specific fertility rates of the specific year.

display.name: Female labor force participation rate (%)
display.unit: % of female population ages 15+ national estimate

sourceDesc: International Labour Organization (via World Bank); UN, World Population Prospects (2022)
